cards.title: Warehouse
cards.description: For as long as your {guild_science} or {guild_barter} member is on the warehouse, whenever you visit a basic {food} or {sheep} tile, you gain +1 {any}.

cards.title: Tailor
cards.description: Gain 1 {wool}.

cards.title: Jeweler
cards.description: Pay 3 {gold} to gain 2 {gems}.

cards.title: Tavern
cards.description: Appoint another player. As long as your {guild_espionage} member is on the tavern, that player must leave at least 2 commoners on their nation.

cards.title: Docks
cards.description: Look at another player's hand.

cards.title: Armory
cards.description: For as long as you {guild_battle} member is on the armory, the strength of all your commoners is increased by 1.

cards.title: Barracks
cards.description: For as long as your {guild_battle} member is on the barracks, its tier is considered to be +1.

cards.title: Church
cards.description: Return all your citizens from a single province to your nation.

cards.title: Cemetery
cards.description: Reactivate a tile that holds one or more of your citizens.

cards.title: Barbican
cards.description: Destroy a commoner on a tile that is in the same province of the barbican.

cards.title: Workshop
cards.description: For as long as your {guild_science} member is on the workshop, {guild_science} and {construct} cards cost 2 {any} less to play.

cards.title: University
cards.description: Draw and reveal cards from the guild deck until you draw a {guild_science} card. Take it into your hand and shuffle the rest back into the deck.

cards.title: Statue
cards.description: Draw and reveal cards from the guild deck until you draw a {guild_celestial} card. Take it into your hand and shuffle the rest back into the deck.

cards.title: City hall
cards.description: Place 3 citizens on the city hall. Target province renounces allegiance to all players and then pledges allegiance to you.

cards.title: Theater
cards.description: Gain 1 {gold} for every commoner on the theater. They return to your nation before the season ends.

cards.title: Lay siege
cards.description: Citizens of target player cannot leave their nation this season.

cards.title: Lay siege
cards.description: Citizens of target player cannot leave their nation this season and cannot perform the gain {food} action at the end of the year.

cards.title: Lay siege
cards.description: Citizens of target player cannot leave their nation this season and cannot perform the gain {food}, gain {gold} or convert {sheep} to {wool} action at the end of the year.

cards.title: Brutish fervor
cards.description: Destroy 1 commoner of another player.

cards.title: Brutish fervor
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Destroy up to 2 commoners divided over up to two players.
  • Destroy 1 tier 1 guild member.

cards.title: Brutish fervor
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Destroy up to 3 commoners divided over up to 3 players.
  • Destroy 1 tier 3 or lower guild member.

cards.title: Demolish
cards.description: Destroy 1 structure or invention.

cards.title: Demolish
cards.description: Destroy 1 structure or invention. Its owner pays you 2 {any}.

cards.title: Demolish
cards.description:
Destroy 1 structure or invention. Any citizens on the same tile are also destroyed.
Its owner pays you 2 {any}.

cards.title: Occupy
cards.description: Choose a province. It cannot be used by other players this season. You may use it during this season.

cards.title: Occupy
cards.description: Choose a province. It cannot be used by other players this season. You may use it during this season. Players that have one or more citizens on said province discard 1 {card}.

cards.title: Occupy
cards.description:
Choose a province. It denounces all players and pledge allegiance to you. Players that have one or more citizens on said province destroy 1 commoner and discard
1 {card}.

cards.title: Wage war
cards.description: Sacrifice X commoners and destroy X commoners divided among up to two players.

cards.title: Wage war
cards.description:
Sacrifice X (at least 1) commoners. Then choose one or both:
  • For every commoner sacrificed this way, destroy 1 commoner divided among up to three players.
  • For every 2 commoners sacrificed this way, destroy 1 tier 1 guild member of target player.

cards.title: Wage war
cards.description:
Sacrifice X (at least 1) commoners. Then choose one or both:
  • Destroy X + 1 commoners divided among up to three players.
  • Destroy one tier 3 or lower guild member of target player.

cards.title: Riot
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Destroy a commoner.
  • Destroy a tier 1 invention.

cards.title: Riot
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Destroy 2 commoners.
  • Destroy a tier 2 invention.
  • Destroy a structure.

cards.title: Riot
cards.description:
Choose two:
  • Destroy a tier 3 or lower guild member.
  • Destroy a tier 3 invention.
  • Destroy 3 commoners divided among up to 3 players.
  • Destroy a structure.

cards.title: Pillage
cards.description: Whenever you gain {gold} this season from a tile other than your nation, take that much {gold} from another player instead of from the general supply. You may name different players each time you place a citizen on such tile.

cards.title: Pillage
cards.description: Whenever you gain {gold} or {food} this season from a tile other than your nation, take that much {gold} or {food} from another player instead of the general supply. You may name a different player each time you place a citizen on such tile.

cards.title: Pillage
cards.description: Whenever you gain {any} this season from a tile other than your nation, take that much {any} from another player instead of from the general supply. Whenever you move to a {card} tile, take 1 {card} from another player at random. You may name a different player each time you place a citizen on such tile.

cards.title: Rampage
cards.description: Appoint a province. Destroy an enemy commoner in every tile of that province that was placed there this season.

cards.title: Rampage
cards.description: Appoint a province. Destroy every enemy commoner in that province that was placed there this season.

cards.title: Rampage
cards.description: Appoint a province. Destroy every enemy citizen in that province.

cards.title: Ambush
cards.description: When another player moves any of their citizens to a tile you are on, destroy one of their commoners committed to that tile before the move action resolves.

cards.title: Ambush
cards.description: When another player moves any of their citizens to a tile you are on, destroy up to two of their commoners committed to that tile before the move action resolves.

cards.title: Ambush
cards.description: When another player moves any of their citizens to a tile you are on, destroy all those citizens before the move action resolves.

cards.title: Overthrow
cards.description: When target player promotes a commoner, immediately destroy it.

cards.title: Overthrow
cards.description: When target player promotes a tier 1 guild member to a tier 2 guild member, immediately destroy it.

cards.title: Overthrow
cards.description: When a player promotes a tier 2 guild member to a tier 3 guild member, immediately destroy that guild member. You may then destroy another guild member of that type.

cards.title: Raid
cards.description: Another player discards 1 {card}.

cards.title: Raid
cards.description: Steal 1 {card} from another player at random. Then they discard 1 {card}.

cards.title: Raid
cards.description:
Look at another player's hand. Then choose two:
  • Choose 2 {card} to discard.
  • Steal 1 {card}.
  • Destroy any tier 2 or lower guild member of that player.

cards.title: Spy
cards.description: Look at another player's hand.

cards.title: Spy
cards.description: Look at another player's hand. Choose 1 {card} and discard it.

cards.title: Spy
cards.description: Look at another player's hand. Choose up to 3 {card} and discard them.

cards.title: Infiltrate
cards.description: Another player’s move actions do not resolve this season.

cards.title: Infiltrate
cards.description: Another player's move actions and cards played don't resolve this season.

cards.title: Infiltrate
cards.description:
Another player's move actions don't resolve this season. Then look at their hand and choose one:
  • Steal 1 {card}.
  • Discard 2 {card}.

cards.title: Abduct
cards.description: Target player’s move action doesn’t resolve unless they pay you 2 {gold} for each commoner they wish to move.

cards.title: Abduct
cards.description: Take 2 commoners from target player. At the end of the year, they either pay you 6 {gold} or you gain control of those commoners.

cards.title: Abduct
cards.description: Take a tier 3 or lower guild member from target player. At the end of the year, either they pay you 10 {gold}, or you gain control of that guild member.

cards.title: Secret meeting
cards.description: Look at another player's hand.

cards.title: Secret meeting
cards.description: Look at target player’s hand. Steal 1 {card}.

cards.title: Secret meeting
cards.description: Look at two player's hands. Steal up to 2 {card} divided among them.

cards.title: Former glory
cards.description: Take 1 {card} from the guild discard pile.

cards.title: Former glory
cards.description: Take 2 {card} from the guild discard pile.

cards.title: Former glory
cards.description: Take 2 {card} from the guild discard pile. Play one of them without paying its cost.

cards.title: Assassinate
cards.description: Destroy a tier 1 guild member

cards.title: Assassinate
cards.description: Destroy guild members of another player. In higher tiers, destroy more and higher guild members.

cards.title: Assassinate
cards.description: Destroy up to 2 tier 3 or lower guild members divided among up to two other players.

cards.title: True intent
cards.description: You may have 1 commoner perform 2 moves and gain both benefits.

cards.title: True intent
cards.description: You may have 1 commoner perform 2 moves and gain both benefits. Then you may draw 1 {card} from the guild deck. If you do, discard 1 {card}.

cards.title: True intent
cards.description: You may have 1 commoner perform 3 moves and gain all benefits. Then you may draw 2 {card} divided as you wish from both decks. If you do, discard 1 {card}.

cards.title: Dark brotherhood
cards.description: When another player promotes a commoner to a member of any guild, promote one of your commoners to a tier 1 member of the {guild_espionage} guild.

cards.title: Dark brotherhood
cards.description: When another player promotes a guild member, promote one of your commoners to a tier 2 member of the {guild_espionage} guild.

cards.title: Dark brotherhood
cards.description: When another player promotes a guild member, prevent that promotion and then promote one of your commoners to a tier 3 member of the {guild_espionage} guild.

cards.title: Perception
cards.description: Prevent a tier 1 guild {card} from resolving.

cards.title: Perception
cards.description: Prevent a tier 2 or lower guild {card} from resolving.

cards.title: Perception
cards.description: Prevent a tier 3 or lower {card} from resolving. Then take that card into your hand.

cards.title: Double agent
cards.description: Look at another player's {promote} card.

cards.title: Double agent
cards.description: Look at another player's {promote} card. Gain a copy of that card.

cards.title: Double agent
cards.description: Look at another player's {promote} card. Steal that card and create a copy of it. Keep the copy as well.

cards.title: Monopoly
cards.description: Name a {any}. Another player pays you up to two of that {any}.

cards.title: Monopoly
cards.description: Name 2 {any}. Each player pays you 1 of those {any}.

cards.title: Monopoly
cards.description: Name 2 {any}. Each player pays you up to 2 of those {any}. Then, draw and reveal cards from the guild deck until you draw a {guild_barter} card. Take it into your hand and shuffle the rest back into the deck.

cards.title: Trade
cards.description:
Give this {card} to another player. Then choose one:
  • They choose 2 {card} and give them to you.
  • Name a {any}. They pay you up to 3 of that {any}.

cards.title: Trade
cards.description:
Give this {card} to another player. Then choose two:
  • They choose 2 {card} and give them to you.
  • Name a {any}. They pay you up to 3 of that {any}.
  • Gain control of one of their commoners.

cards.title: Trade
cards.description:
Give this {card} to another player. Then choose two:
  • Look at their hand and take 2 {card}.
  • Name a {any}. They pay you up to 5 of that {any}.
  • Gain control of 2 of their commoners.

cards.title: Taxes
cards.description: This season, if another player plays a guild {card}, they must pay you 1 {gold}.

cards.title: Taxes
cards.description: This season, if another player plays a guild {card} or activates a non-basic tile, they must pay you 1 {gold}

cards.title: Taxes
cards.description: For the remainder of this year, if another player plays a guild {card} or activates any tile, they must pay you 2 {gold}.

cards.title: Bribery
cards.description:
You may repeat this action up to two times (and choose different players).
Pay another player 4 {gold} to gain control of a commoner.

cards.title: Bribery
cards.description:
You may repeat this action up to three times (and choose different players).
Choose one:
  • Pay another player 4 {gold} to gain control of a commoner.
  • Pay another player 8 {gold} to gain control of a tier 1 citizen.

cards.title: Bribery
cards.description:
You may repeat this action up to five times (and choose different players).
Choose one:
  • Pay another player 3 {gold} to gain control of a commoner.
  • Pay another player 6 {gold} to gain control of a tier 1 citizen.
  • Pay another player 9 {gold} to gain control of a tier 2 citizen.

cards.title: Time is money
cards.description: You may move any number of commoners from one tile to another tile. Normal movement rules apply.

cards.title: Time is money
cards.description: You may move any number of commoners from two tiles to two other tiles. Normal movement rules apply.

cards.title: Time is money
cards.description: You may move any number of commoners from two tiles to two other tiles. Normal movement rules apply. Then draw a card from the promote deck.

cards.title: An offer you can't refuse
cards.description: Another player draws and reveals a {card} from the guild deck and pays you 3 {any}.

cards.title: An offer you can't refuse
cards.description: Another player draws and reveals a {card} from the guild deck and pays you 5 {any}. Then you draw a {card} from the guild deck.

cards.title: An offer you can't refuse
cards.description: Target player draws and reveals a {card} from the guild deck and pays you 7 {any}. Then you draw a {card} from the promote deck.

cards.title: Loan
cards.description: You give target player 5 {gold}. At the end of the next 3 seasons, they pay you back 3 {gold}.

cards.title: Loan
cards.description:
You give target player 6 {food}. At the end of the next 3 seasons, they pay you back
4 {food}. Choose one per season they can't pay:
  • Take any 3 {any} from them.
  • Gain control of 1 of their commoners.
  • A province denounces that player.
  • Randomly take 1 {card} from them.

cards.title: Loan
cards.description:
Give another player this {card}. At the end of the next 3 seasons, they pay you back
1 {card}. Choose two per season they can't pay:
  • Take any 3 {any} from them.
  • Gain control of 1 of their commoners.
  • Gain control of 1 of their tier 1 guild members.
  • A province denounces that player.

cards.title: Prosperity
cards.description: Gain 2 {gold} and draw 1 {card} from the guild deck.

cards.title: Prosperity
cards.description: Gain 4 {gold}, 2 {sheep} and draw a {card} from the guild deck.

cards.title: Prosperity
cards.description: Gain 5 {gold}, 4 {sheep}, 2 {gems} and draw a {card} from the guild deck.

cards.title: First come, first serve
cards.description: This season, moving any of your citizens to a {any} or {card} tile triggers that tile twice.

cards.title: First come, first serve
cards.description: This season, moving any of your citizens to a {any}, structure or {card} tile triggers that tile twice.

cards.title: First come, first serve
cards.description: For the rest of the year, moving any of your citizens to a {any}, structure or {card} tile triggers that tile twice.

cards.title: Investment
cards.description: This season, all your {gold} income is increased by +1.

cards.title: Investment
cards.description: This season and the next, all your {gold} income is increased by + 1.

cards.title: Investment
cards.description: For the remainder of this year, all your {gold} income is increased by + 2 and {gems} is increased by +1.

cards.title: Real-estate investor
cards.description: For the remainder of the year, gain control of target player’s structure or invention.

cards.title: Real-estate investor
cards.description: Take control of target player’s structure or invention.

cards.title: Real-estate investor
cards.description: Take control of two structures or inventions (you may choose different players). Then keep drawing and revealing {card} from the guild deck until you find a {construct} card, take it into your hand and shuffle the rest of the cards back into the deck.

cards.title: Feed the poor
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Gain 3 {food}.
  • Gain 2 {food}. Another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gains 1 {food}. This tier is free to play.

cards.title: Feed the poor
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Gain 4 {food} and 2 {sheep}.
  • Gain 2 {food} and 2 {sheep}. Another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gains 2 {food}. This card costs 2 {gold} to play.

cards.title: Feed the poor
cards.description:
Choose one:
  • Gain 4 {food}, 3 {sheep} and 1 {wool}.
  • Gain 2 {food}, 2 {sheep} and 1 {wool}. Another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gains 2 {food} and 1 {sheep}. This card costs 3 {gold} to play.

cards.title: Indoctrinate
cards.description:
You may have another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gain control of one commoner you own. If you do, this card costs 1 {gold} to play.
Name a province. At the end of the next season, you gain control of 1 commoner in every tile of that province.

cards.title: Indoctrinate
cards.description:
You may have another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gain control of one commoner you own. If you do, this card costs 3 {gold} to play.
Name a province. At the end of the next season, you gain control of all commoners in every tile of that province.

cards.title: Indoctrinate
cards.description:
You may have another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member gain control of one commoner you own. If you do, this card costs 2 {sheep} to play.
Name a province. At the end of the next season, you gain control of all commoners in every tile and citizens in up to two tiles of that province.

cards.title: Go forth and multiply
cards.description: Create 1 commoner.

cards.title: Go forth and multiply
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player gains 1 commoner. If you do, this card costs 3 {food} to play.
Create 1 commoner for every two commoners under your control.

cards.title: Go forth and multiply
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player gains 1 commoner. If you do, this card costs 3 {food} to play.
Choose one or both:
  • Create 1 commoner for every two commoners under your control.
  • Promote a commoner to any tier 1 guild member.

cards.title: Resurrection
cards.description: Return up to two commoners under your control that were destroyed this season to your nation.

cards.title: Resurrection
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player gains 1 commoner. If you do, this card costs (1 {gold}, 2 {food}) to play.
Return up to three commoners under your control that were destroyed this season to your nation.

cards.title: Resurrection
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player takes control of 1 commoner you own. If you do, this card costs (1 {gold}, 2 {food}, 1 {wool}) to play.
Return up to 2 tier 2 or lower guild members and up to three commoners under your control that were destroyed this season to your nation.

cards.title: Divine intervention
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player takes control of 1 commoner you own. If you do, this card costs 2 {food} to play.
Prevent up to three commoners from being destroyed.

cards.title: Divine intervention
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player takes control of 1 commoner you own. If you do, this card costs (2 {gold}, 2 {food}) to play.
Prevent up to three citizens from being destroyed. Then promote a commoner to a tier 1 {guild_celestial} member.

cards.title: Divine intervention
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. That player takes control of 1 commoner you own. If you do, this card costs (2 {food}, 2 {sheep}) to play.
Prevent up to three citizens from being destroyed. Then promote a commoner to a tier 2 {guild_celestial} member.

cards.title: God's will
cards.description: Choose a guild {card} from your hand and create a copy of it.

cards.title: God's will
cards.description: Choose a guild {card} from your hand and create two copies of it.

cards.title: God's will
cards.description:
Choose two:
  • Choose a guild {card} from your hand and create two copies of it.
  • Choose a promote {card} and create a copy of it.
  • Create 2 commoners.

cards.title: Devotion
cards.description: Sacrifice a commoner. Destroy 2 commoners of another player.

cards.title: Devotion
cards.description: Sacrifice a commoner. Destroy 2 commoners of another player. Then draw a {card} from the guild deck.

cards.title: Devotion
cards.description: Sacrifice a commoner. Destroy 2 commoners of a player. Destroy one tier 2 or lower guild member of another player. Draw a {card} from any deck.

cards.title: Tolerance
cards.description: When any of your citizens would be returned to your nation from any 1 basic tile, move them to another valid tile instead and immediately gain its benefits.

cards.title: Tolerance
cards.description: When any of your citizens would be returned to your nation from any 1 basic tile, move them to two separate valid tiles instead and immediately gain their benefits.

cards.title: Tolerance
cards.description: When any of your citizens would be returned to your nation from any 1 basic tile, reactivate  that tile and then move them to two separate valid tiles and immediately gain their benefits.

cards.title: Sunday prayer
cards.description: Return all commoners in one province to your nation

cards.title: Sunday prayer
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. They return commoners from a single tile to their nation. If you do, this card costs (2 {gold}, 2 {food}).
Return all commoners to your nation. Each generates 1 {gold}.

cards.title: Sunday prayer
cards.description:
You may appoint another player who owns at least 1 {guild_celestial} member. They gain 1 commoner. If you do, this card costs (2 {gold}, 2 {food}).
Return all commoners to your nation. For each commoner returned this way, choose one:
  • Generate 2 {gold}.
  • Generate 1 {food}.
  • Turn 1 {sheep} into 1 {wool}.

cards.title: Construct
cards.description: The next invention or structure costs 2 {any} less.

cards.title: Construct
cards.description: The next invention or structure card you play is free.

cards.title: Construct
cards.description: The next invention or structure card you play is free. Then play a tier 2 invention for free.

cards.title: Fort
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on a tile. Other players who wish to visit that tile, must commit at least 2 strength. If they do, destroy the invention.

cards.title: Fort
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on two basic tiles within a single province. Other players who wish to visit those tiles must commit at least strength 3. If they do, destroy the invention.

cards.title: Fort
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on all basic tiles of a single province. Other players who wish to visit those tiles must commit at least strength 3. If they do, destroy the invention.

cards.title: Grindstone
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on a {any} tile. At the end of each season that the invention is on that tile, you gain 1 {any} listed on that tile. Other players can still visit the tile, but to remove the invention, they must commit at least strength 2 there.

cards.title: Grindstone
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on two {any} tiles within a single province. At the end of each season, you gain 1 {any} listed on those tiles. Other players can still visit the tile, but to remove the invention, they must commit at least strength 2 there.

cards.title: Grindstone
cards.description: Create a strength 1 construction on all basic tiles within a single province. At the end of each season, you gain the benefits listed on the tile. Other players can still visit the tile, but to remove the invention, they must commit at least strength 2 there.

cards.title: Wagon
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on a {gold} or {food} tile. Whenever you visit this tile, increase the tile production by +2. Other players can still visit the tile, but to destroy the invention, they must commit at least strength 2 there.

cards.title: Wagon
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on a {gold}, {food} or {sheep} tile. Whenever you visit this tile, increase the tile production by +3. Other players can still visit the tile, but to destroy the invention, they must commit at least strength 3 there.

cards.title: Wagon
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on two {gold}, {food}, {sheep} or {gems} tiles. Whenever you visit these tiles, increase the tile production by +4. Other players can still visit the tile, but to destroy the invention, they must commit at least strength 3 there.

cards.title: Siege machine
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on another player’s nation. As long as the invention is active on their nation, citizens cannot leave. That player must spend at least strength 2 to remove the invention. Citizens occupied with removing the invention are removed from the game until the start of next year.

cards.title: Siege machine
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on another player’s nation. As long as the invention is active on their nation, citizens cannot leave. At the end of every season that the invention remains on their nation, they lose 1 {food}. That player must spend at least strength 3 to remove the invention. Citizens occupied with removing the invention are removed from the game until the start of next year.

cards.title: Siege machine
cards.description: Create a strength 3 invention on another player’s nation. As long as the invention is active on their nation, citizens cannot leave. At the end of every season that the invention remains on their nation, they lose 1 {food} and 1 {sheep}. That player must spend at least strength 4 to remove the invention. Citizens occupied with removing the invention are removed from the game until the start of next year.

cards.title: Horseback
cards.description: Create a strength 1 invention on your nation and place two commoners in it. During each season, the invention can move to an adjacent tile in a province that pledged allegiance to you to gain their benefits. Other players can destroy the invention by committing at least strength 2 on its current location.

cards.title: Horseback
cards.description: Create a strength 2 invention on your nation and place a commoner in it. During each season, the invention can move to an adjacent tile to gain its benefits. Other players can destroy the invention by committing at least strength 3 on its current location.

cards.title: Horseback
cards.description: Create a strength 3 invention on your nation and place a commoner in it. During each season, the construction can move to an adjacent tile - even in provinces that have not pledged allegiance to you - to gain its benefits. Other players can destroy the invention by committing at least strength 4 to its current location.

cards.title: Booby-trap
cards.description: When a player visits a structure you control, destroy a commoner before the move action is resolved.

cards.title: Booby-trap
cards.description: When a player visits a structure you control, destroy 2 commoners before the move action is resolved. Gain the   cost they had to pay to visit it.

cards.title: Booby-trap
cards.description: When another player visits a structure you control, destroy all citizens committed before the move action resolves. Draw a {card} from the guild deck and play a tier 1 invention for free.

cards.title: Built to last
cards.description: Counter a card that targets a structure or invention unless its owner pays you 3 {gold}.

cards.title: Built to last
cards.description: Counter a card that targets a structure or invention unless that player pays you 4 {gold}. Then play a tier 1 invention for free.

cards.title: Built to last
cards.description: Counter a card that targets a structure or invention unless that player pays you 5 {gold}. Then play a tier 2 invention for free.

cards.title: Age of enlightening
cards.description: Draw and reveal five {card} from the guild deck. If there is one or more {guild_science} cards among them, keep 1. Otherwise play a tier 1 invention for free. Then shuffle the rest of the cards back into the guild deck.

cards.title: Age of enlightening
cards.description: Draw and reveal seven {card} from the guild deck. If there is one or more {guild_science} cards among them, keep them. Otherwise play a tier 1 invention for free. Then shuffle the rest of the cards back into the guild deck.

cards.title: Age of enlightening
cards.description: Play 2 random tier 2 inventions for free. Then draw and reveal {card} froom the guild deck until you find a {guild_science} card and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest of the cards back into the deck.

cards.title: Promote
cards.description:
• Commoner -> Tier 1: At least 3 provinces must have pledged allegiance to you.

  • Tier 1 -> Tier 2: At least 4 provinces must have pledged allegiance to you.

  • Tier 2 -> Tier 3: At least 6 provinces must have pledged allegiance to you.

cards.title: Promote
cards.description:
• Commoner -> Tier 1: At least 3 of your citizens must be on the same province.

  • Tier 1 -> Tier 2: At least 5 of your citizens must be on the same province.

  • Tier 2 -> Tier 3: At least 8 of your citizens must be on the same province

cards.title: Promote
cards.description:
• Commoner -> Tier 1: At least 2 of your citizens must be on the same basic tile.

  • Tier 1 -> Tier 2: At least 4 of your citizens must be on the same basic tile.

  • Tier 2 -> Tier 3: At least 6 of your citizens must be on the same basic tile

cards.title: Promote
cards.description:
• Commoner -> Tier 1: You must have at least 5 commoners under your control.

  • Tier 1 -> Tier 2: You must have at least 8 commoners under your control.

  • Tier 2 -> Tier 3: You must have at least 11 commoners under your control.

entities.name: barracks
entities.description: a barracks trains soldiers. Soldiers can fight other units and help you invade other towns.
